sen.j: 桂川 甫周（かつらがわ ほしゅう、1826年（文政9年）- 1881年（明治14年）9月25日）は、医師及び蘭学者。
sen.e: Hoshu KATSURAGAWA (1826 - September 25, 1881) was a doctor and Dutch scholar.
Hoshu KATSURAGAWA (1826 - September 25, 1881) was a doctor and Dutch scholar.
Hoshu KATSURAGAWA (1826 - September 25, 1881) was a doctor and Dutch scholar.

sen.j: 名は国興（くにおき）であり、甫周は通称である。
sen.e: His name was Kunioki and commonly called as Hoshu.
His name was Kunioki and commonly called as Hoshu.
His name was Kunioki and commonly called as Hoshu.

sen.j: 父は6代目である甫賢、娘に今泉みね（名ごりの夢を著した作家）。
sen.e: His father was Hoshu the sixth, and he had a daughter, Mine IMAIZUMI (a novelist who wrote "Nagori no Yume")
His father was Hoken the sixth, and he had a daughter, Mine IMAIZUMI (a novelist who wrote "Nagori no Yume").
His father was Hoken the sixth, and he had a daughter, Mine IMAIZUMI (a novelist who wrote "Nagori no Yume").

sen.j: オランダ商館長（カピタン）のヘンドリック・ドゥーフが、先に刊行されていたフランソワ・ハルマ(François Halma)の『蘭仏辞書』（1729年）を参考に著した『ドゥーフ・ハルマ』（通布字典、1833年完成）を校正及び改訂し、安政2年（1855年）に上巻・安政5年（1858年）に下巻の2巻からなる『和蘭字彙』を発行した。
sen.e: Hoshu proofread and revised "Doeff-Halma Dictionary" (通布字典, completed in 1833) by Hendrik Doeff, the curator of Dutch trading house, the Kapitan, who compiled this dictionary with reference to François Halma's "Dutch-French Dictionary" (1729) which was published before, and issued "Waran Jii" (Japanese-Dutch Dictionary) in two volumes, first volume was published in 1855, and second one was published in 1858.
sen.cmt: 通布 は、ドゥーフを漢字にあてて表記したもののようです
sen.e: Hoshu proofread and revised "Doeff-Halma Dictionary" (通布字典, completed in 1833) by Hendrik Doeff, the curator of Dutch trading house, the Kapitan, who compiled this dictionary with reference to François Halma's "Dutch-French Dictionary" (1729) which was published before, and issued "Waran Jii" (Japanese-Dutch Dictionary) in two volumes, first volume was published in 1855, and second one was published in 1858.

Hoshu proofread and revised "Doeff-Halma Dictionary" (通布字典, completed in 1833) by Hendrik Doeff, the curator of Dutch trading house, the Kapitan, who compiled this dictionary with reference to François Halma's "Dutch-French Dictionary" (1729) which was published before, and issued "Waran Jii" (Japanese-Dutch Dictionary) in two volumes, first volume was published in 1855, and second one was published in 1858.

sen.j: 同書は、9万語を収録し本格的な蘭和辞典として江戸時代の最高峰にあり、また対訳辞典の基礎としてその後の辞典に大きな影響を及ぼした。
sen.e: This dictionary which contained 90,000 words was top grade as a full-scale Japanese-Dutch Dictionary in Edo Period, and made a major influence on the later dictionaries as the basis of parallel translation dictionary.

This dictionary which contained 90,000 words was top grade as a full-scale Japanese-Dutch Dictionary in Edo Period, and made a major influence on the later dictionaries as the basis of parallel translation dictionary.
